## Description of Requirements
The Department of Finance Canada requires the services of a consultant to support the activities of the Sustainable Finance Action Council (SFAC) for the third year of its mandate, concluding at the end of March 2024. The consultant will leverage their experience in sustainable finance, subject matter expertise, and experience supporting private sector bodies advising the official sector to provide effective support for SFAC's mandate.

## Requirements
* Minimum Security Level Required: Canada - Protected A, Protected B (Special comments: DOS - Reliability)
* Applicable Trade Agreements:
	+ World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement
	+ Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canadian Free Trade Agreement
	+ Comprehensive Economic Trade Agreement
	+ Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership
	+ Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement

## Resource Requirements
The proposed period of contract is from July 1, 2023 to March 31, 2024. Estimated level of effort includes:
* 1 Senior Business Consultant: 35 days
* 1 Intermediate Business Consultant: 48 days
* 2 Junior Business Consultant: 77 days

## Contracting Authority
Justin Foubert, procurement-approvisionnement@fin.gc.ca, (343) 571-3669

## Timing
The deadline for submitting proposals was 2023-06-13T14:00:00, and the tender is expired. Note: The Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) Method of Supply is subject to quarterly refresh cycles.
